history.content:
Dear EECS and L&S CS Students,

We are holding a workshop for the NSF Graduate Research Fellowship on Wednesday, September 9 from 4-5PM in the Woz.  US Citizens and Permanent Residents in their senior year of college or first year of graduate school should not miss this opportunity. Come hear about the application process and campus resources to help you prepare your application from NSF Coordiantor Michael Sacramento, as well as advice from current EECS students supported by the award.  Also, check out the bSpace site for applicants!

EECS NSF GRF Applicant Workshop:
A workshop for applicants will be held Wednesday, September 9 from 4:00 PM – 5:00 PM in the Wozniak Lounge, Soda Hall
The workshop will provide valuable tips that will assist in strengthening applications.  Speakers include UCB’s NSF fellowship coordinator and three current EECS NSFfellows.

Graduate Division's NSF GRF bSpace:
UC Berkeley provides an online resource center on bSpace for Berkeley administrators, advisers and students who are interested in learning about the National Science Foundation Graduate Research Fellowship (NSF GRF). Graduate Division's NSF GRF bSpace provides centralized information regarding the fellowship and resources to assist in improving NSF GRF applications. Resources include videos of past NSF GRF Applicant Workshops and a Mentorship Program.
history.subject: NSF Applicant Workshop
